author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: سُبْحانَكَ يا إِلهِي تَعْلَمُ بَلائِي وَما وَرَدَ عَلَيَّ مِنَ الَّذِيْنَ طافُوا حَولِي مِنَ العِبادِ الَّذِيْنَ كَفَرُوا بِآياتِكَ الكُبْرى وَأَعْرَضُوا عَنْ طَلْعَتِكَ النَّوْرآءِ، وَعِزَّ
translation: Glorified art Thou, O my Lord! Thou beholdest my tribulations and all that hath befallen me at the hands of such of Thy servants as keep company with me, who have disbelieved in Thy most resplendent signs, and turned back from Thy most effulgent Beauty. I swear by Thy glory! Such are the troubles that vex me, that no pen in the entire creation can either reckon or describe them.
